explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a novel model called kernel fuzzy twin support vector machine (KFT-SVM), which is a machine learning approach for financial risk prediction.
explanations.supervised learning: The KFT-SVM model is a supervised learning method as it is trained on labeled data to classify financial risks.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on developing an early warning system for extreme financial risks, which involves classifying financial data into risk categories.
explanations.support vector machine: The proposed model is based on the support vector machine (SVM) framework, specifically extending the twin support vector machine (T-SVM) approach.
explanations.SVM: The paper directly mentions SVM and its variants (T-SVM, FT-SVM) as baseline methods for comparison with the proposed KFT-SVM model.
